Linux can network with anything.
My opinion is that you should not count on your Windows applications to work, generally.
No need for av software for Linux just yet, but something like ClamAV will filter windows viruses from emails and such.
No Windows only software will work with Linux without a compatibility layer like wine. www.winehq.org will give more details if you like I think.
If you are serious about the switch, I'd suggest searching for Linux alternatives for your software if possible.
www.google.com/linux is a good resource.
